skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: These coaches serve as a way of transporting a Vampire anywhere he wishes, plowing through any opposition that would dare to stand in her way.

attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

skillTree.localised_description: Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: "If you need the strength, then turn to me…"
"Come to my side, my servants. Now, you are bound, irrevocably, to my will forever!"

Aucassin's staff is a mixture of fearful living servants and craven thralls dominated by his will, and the Vampire is served by a group of knights drawn from distant branches of his family, whom he carefully vets to see which ones to turn into Vampires so they can better serve him.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -15% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction time: -15% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Aucassin's charm and skills as a host mask all but the slightest indications that he is a monstrously soulless predator. Beneath his facade, Aucassin is literally a cold-blooded murderer with no concept of another's suffering, and when dealing with those he does not consider his guests, he is as utterly merciless as any degenerate Vampire.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Aucassin's role in Mallobaude's plan is to act as Mallobaude's voice in gathering the support of other nobles. Aucassin's considerable wealth and the competence of his courtly money-counters means he is also useful for arranging the raising and supplying of Mallobaude's potential army.

effects.description: +10% chance of improving relations with nearby factions each turn

skillTree.localised_description: Aucassin can immobilize his opponents with nothing more than his gaze.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
This one will not go down easily – it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
An omen, a sign - this being knows things and any who follow will share their glory.
Never to be broken or dishonoured – never to succumb to the foe.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Invocation of Nehek"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Invocation of Nehek Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Invocation of Nehek Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: As the powers of Dark Magic are wielded for the purpose of Necromancy, its unwholesome energies invigorate the Undead.

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flock of Doom"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"
Spell number of uses: +1 for "Raise Dead" and "Raise Dead Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Skeleton Warriors

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for "Raise Dead Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Kadon, a master of forms, was able to shift his shape into anything he chose. Here, his magic is used to summon a Varghulf, as if Kadon himself fights for you.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -6 for "Transformation of Kadon"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Wind of Death"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Wind of Death Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Wind of Death Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 6%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 9%

skillTree.localised_description: Such magic-users may be wise and able to offer sage advice, especially if they have scried the region.

effects.description: Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 2%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 4%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6%
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: "I'm no pupil, but an adept! A hex on them, may their souls shrivel from their bones!"

effects.description: Assault Unit action: Additional 5% damage caused
Assault Unit action: Additional 15% damage caused
Assault Unit action: Additional 30% damage caused

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The noble Aucassin is one of the most quietly influential men in Mousillon, and he is a key lieutenant to Mallobaude.

effects.description: A small chance of improving diplomacy relations with factions that he visits
